body.name: Rockin' Green Classic Rock Laundry Detergent (90 Loads), Plant based, All Natural Laundry Detergent Powder, Vegan and Biodegradable Odor Fighter, Safe for Sensitive Skin, 45 oz (AC/DSea Breeze)

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: Tough Stain & Odor Eliminator - Say goodbye to tough stains and odor with Rockin' Green Classic Rock all natural laundry detergent powder! Designed to work in soft to normal water with less than 180ppm mineral content, this powder laundry detergent is enzyme-free to give your clothes that gentle clean.

Plant-Powered Ingredients - Dermatologist-tested and hypoallergenic, this laundry soap powder is made with plant-derived ingredients so it's safe even for babies and kids. Unscented and all-natural, this plant-based powder detergent uses an enzyme-free formula that’s great for delicate clothes and gentle on sensitive skin.

Suitable For All Washing Machines - This 45-oz laundry powder works well with all types of washing machine, and cleans approximately 90 loads! Just add 1 scoop and run your usual wash cycle. Or add an extra scoop to deep clean. Use on bed sheets, jeans, shirts, towels, and kids' clothing.

Cleaner Clothes, Cleaner Planet - Live a cleaner, greener lifestyle with our laundry detergent powder, natural and 100% biodegradable. Free of bleach, dyes, parabens, phosphates, phthalates, SLS/SLES, optical brighteners, and artificial fragrances, Rockin' Green cleaning products are vegan and cruelty-free.

Rock the Green Lifestyle - We are on a mission to create economical, hardworking and biodegradable cleaning products to meet the demands of every family. We’d love for you to join the Rockin’ Green movement and enjoy safe and reliable products! If you are not satisfied with your purchase, contact our customer support and we'll get back to you within 48 hours.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful detergent for cloth diapers
reviews.reviewText: For the first 4 months of cloth diapering, I used Country Save HE Laundry Detergent, Powder, 160-Load, 10-lb Boxes (Case of 4) . I have a front loading LG Tronn machine, and I would do a rinse/spin cycle with a smidge of Country Save, then a heavy soiled normal wash on hot with 1/4-1/2 the "standard amount" of detergent, followed by one or two rinse and spin cycles. This worked pretty well, until I moved.If there's one thing you'll learn about cloth diapers, it's that your laundry system will be completely different from everyone else's due to your child's body chemistry, your diaper brands, your water quality, and your washing machine. Though we kept the same machines, the water at our new location was incredibly different, and after a cycle or two of washing diapers in the new house, my son's rump was red and rashy! Needing some new laundry solutions, I decided to get Rockin' Green and I am so glad I did.The Smashing Watermelons variety smells wonderful, just like watermelon Bubble Yum gum! Too bad the smell does not stay on the diapers (though I can see how that would be bad for babies with sensitive skin). The Rockin' Green website is brilliant - they have a very informative FAQ, as well as suggested washing cycles broken down by type of machine. Plus the small looking bag claims to last up to 90 loads! One important thing to keep in mind is that when you use Rockin' Green for the first time, you have to be very careful. It will suck the chemical residue out of your diapers, so if you do not run a whole bunch of rinses, your child might get a worse diaper rash than she started off with. If you have particular stubborn residue, stains, or stinkies, do a soak in Rockin' Green. My son's butt is back to being happy, and my diapers look and smell cleaner than ever. My new washing cycle is - delicate cycle with water plus option to rinse the diapers, cotton cycle with water plus and 2 tablespoons of Rockin' Green to wash, followed by one or two delicate cycles with water plus to rinse.If you have hard water, you might need to use more than 2 tbsps, if you have very soft water, 1 tbsp might suffice. If your water is especially hard, use Rockin' Green Cloth Diaper & Laundry Detergent (Hard Rock, Bare Naked Babies) , and if your baby has very sensitive skin, try Rockin' Green Cloth Diaper & Laundry Detergent (Soft Rock, Bare Naked Babies) .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for cloth diapers!
reviews.reviewText: I have been using rockin green for years to wash cloth diapers. It works great and I never have smells or stains in my cloth diapers. I soak my cloth diapers in a plastic bucket with water and vinegar (I throw them in there until I am ready to wash them). Then I use the rockin green detergent in the wash machine with the diapers. Then I hang dry them on my deck. It's the perfect system. I have prefolds that I have had for about 5 years that still are in perfect condition with no smells or stains and still absorb perfectly! I have seen other moms complain on social media mom groups about rockin green saying it isn't good for cloth diapers, but obviously when they have only been doing cloth diapers for a year or less, and I have been doing it for about 5 plus years... Its very possible they are not using it properly. You DO NOT need much detergent with rockin green. My last bag lasted a few months and I wash diapers two to three times a week. The only reason I am knocking a star off is because I do wish they came in larger bags so I could order less often. I have so far successfully cloth diapered 3 out of four children and am going to be cloth diapering my new baby who is due any day now too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Working around heavy machinery I need a tough Detergent. This Detergent works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly and refreshingly neutral
reviews.reviewText: I purchased both this and Funk Rock out of absolute desperation and need for something different and I am so glad I did. With a constant flux of bed wetting and sports clothes that just can't seem to shake their smell, I needed something different. I had tried all of the special off the shelf sport washes, oxy, borax, and vinegar to get out the smells... and they only seemed to be getting worse! I had a small pile of clothes sitting in my laundry room that seemed to be forever ruined. After receiving these, I did a soak cycle of funk rock and a wash cycle of funk rock and classic rock (just 1 Tablespoon each)and to my surprise the smells were gone! No pee smell, no body odor smell, no sour smell on ANYTHING. Everything that came out of my dryer smelled surprisingly and refreshingly neutral. ...and I honestly couldn't be happier. I purchased the lavender mint, which is very light and faint, and like I said, smells neutral/fresh once out of the dryer. No masking with something strong smelling or perfume-y. I tried to use up the remainder of my liquid detergent on my towels, but each time I do, they go back to smelling bad. So I guess I'm just going to have to trash or donate my old detergent. Thank you, these have proven themselves to be subscribe and save worthy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I can't believe how great this works for the amount you use.I got this to test since my wife and I are planning on using cloth diapers when we have kids, and a lot of my clothes feel like they have and oily/ greasy feel to them at times and aren't getting clean. I used this first on some white sheets of ours with pretty heavy sweat stains that hang on no matter how often we wash them, and we can't use bleach since there is a pattern on them. After using this and letting it soak for an hour in the washer, the sheets came out clean, no stains what so ever! I've since used this on my clothes and they are cleaner than ever, with no greasy feeling

reviews.reviewTitle: ONLY detergent that will keep reusable diapers looking brand new
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is SO GOOD. It’s actually unbelievable how well it works. It is the ONLY detergent I have found that properly gets reusable diapers clean. One rinse cycle, then two scoops of this in the regular wash cycle and they come out looking brand new. Honestly, this stuff is incredible and NECESSARY if you are doing reusable diapers!!
Very good for sport/waterproof garments or yoga clothing.You don’t need to use a lot, so it last a long time

reviews.reviewTitle: It's actually better that baby's clothes just smell neutral when they come ...
reviews.reviewText: We use this for cloth baby diapers (hot water) and baby clothes (cold water). Everything has come out clean. The scent is so mild that it's really just something to smell before it goes in the machine. It's actually better that baby's clothes just smell neutral when they come out. He's had no skin allergies or issues. Have bought a few bags and the first few were missing the scoop (I read some reviews that this happened to others). No big deal, we just used a tsp measuring spoon (usually used 1.5 tsp) for regular load. Worked well and would recommend.
This soap (along with a laundry treatment from a different brand) saved my cloth diapers. They're clean and absorbent again. Will continue to purchase.
My daughter has sensitive skin and so we use to wash our clothes. I would highly recommend it and especially for those who have sensitive skin.
